visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts map chartOptions object to render a map of US counties with unemployment rates. The chart should have a title 'US Counties unemployment rates, January 2018'. The axes and labels should be styled with specific colors and font sizes. The data series should include the unemployment rates for each county, with a custom tooltip displaying the state acronym. The chart should also include state borders and a legend with a specific background color.
visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render a map of US counties with unemployment rates. The chart type is a map, specifically designed to display geographical data. The title of the chart is 'US Counties unemployment rates, January 2018', styled with a dark color and a larger font size for better visibility. The legend is positioned to the right, vertically aligned, and has a semi-transparent white background. The color axis is set to range from 0 to 25 with a tick interval of 5, using a gradient of colors to represent different unemployment rates. The labels on the color axis are formatted to display the percentage values and are styled with a smaller font size and a dark color. The plot options include a mapline series to display state borders in white, which are not shown in the legend and do not track mouse events. The main series displays the unemployment rates for each county, with a tooltip showing the percentage value and the state acronym. The chart also includes navigation options to allow users to interact with the map.
